thread.title: 8 Outstanding Egg Sandwiches in San Francisco
thread.title_full: 8 Outstanding Egg Sandwiches in San Francisco

author: Stefanie Tuder
title: 8 Outstanding Egg Sandwiches in San Francisco
text:
8 Outstanding Egg Sandwiches in San Francisco All Feb 22, 2017, 12:01pm PST Plow's breakfast sandwich. Amelinda L./Yelp 
A breakfast egg sandwich can come in many, many forms â€” fried eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, fake bacon, sausage, cheese, Taylor ham, on a roll, on a bun, on two slices of bread. But no matter what, it's always so damn satisfying. 
Especially the versions on this list, which get the San Francisco treatment from chefs around town, which means things like housemade biscuits and sausage, always perfectly runny eggs, and high-quality ingredients. Whether you want a straighforward version of the classic bacon, egg, and cheese, or you want to pump it up with something like a duck sausage, this list has your morning cravings covered. 
For your many morning needs, here are eight excellent versions of the breakfast sandwich throughout San Francisco . Looking for a nice sit-down breakfast instead? Do consider one of these options then. 
Did we miss your favorite? Tell us all about your top sandwich in the comments. 1 4505 Burgers & BBQ 
Available at the Divisadero location on the weekends and at the Ferry Building farmers market 4505 Meat stand on Saturdays from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., the breakfast sandwich has a maple bacon breakfast sausage patty, gruyere cheese, sunny-side up egg and peppercress on griddled sesame and scallion bun.
